dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: Flurkarte der Umgebung von Dresden, mit Genehmigung des KÃ¶niglich SÃ¤chsischen Finanzministeriums hergestellt auf Grund der topographischen Kart von Sachsen im MaÃŸstabe 1:25000. It was published by Giescke   Devrient in 1903. Scale 1:25,000. Covers Dresden, Germany region. Map in German. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Deutsches Hauptdreiecksnetz (DHDN) 3-degree Gauss-Kruger Zone 5 coordinate system. All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as roads, railroads and stations, drainage, built-up areas and selected buildings, city and town boundaries, and more. Relief is shown by contours and spot heights. This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from The Harvard Map Collection as part of the Imaging the Urban Environment project. Maps selected for this project represent major urban areas and cities of the world, at various time periods. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features at a large scale. The selection represents a range of regions, originators, ground condition dates, scales, and purposes.
